question: 7 (c)
statement_html:
Cholera is a disease that can spread through untreated sewage polluting the drinking water supply. Let \(\displaystyle y(t)\) be the fraction of people in a population who have the disease at time t. Assume that in a certain city, the fraction of people who have the disease increases at a rate proportional to the fraction of people who do not yet have the disease. (We will use \(\displaystyle k > 0\) as the constant of proportionality).

(c) Use one clear sentence and a simple sketch to explain what happens to the fraction of infected individuals as time goes by.
statement_latex:
Cholera is a disease that can spread through untreated sewage polluting
the drinking water supply. Let $\displaystyle y(t)$ be the fraction of
people in a population who have the disease at time \emph{t}. Assume
that in a certain city, the fraction of people who have the disease
increases at a rate proportional to the fraction of people who do not
yet have the disease. (We will use $\displaystyle k > 0$ as the constant
of proportionality).

(c) Use one clear sentence and a simple sketch to explain what happens
to the fraction of infected individuals as time goes by.
statement_raw:
Cholera is a disease that can spread through untreated sewage polluting the drinking water supply. Let <math> \displaystyle y(t)</math> be the fraction of people in a population who have the disease at time ''t''. Assume that in a certain city, the fraction of people who have the disease increases at a rate proportional to the fraction of people who do not yet have the disease. (We will use <math> \displaystyle k > 0</math> as the constant of proportionality).

(c) Use one clear sentence and a simple sketch to explain what happens to the fraction of infected individuals as time goes by.
